page.title: 13Interview with the Coulmans
page.content: Mr Coulman has 580 acres, 25 years ago 550 acres. Crops grown now, wheat, barley, beet, peas. Before 60 acres grass 70 acres potatoes 40 acres beet 80 acres peas 250 cattle. It's warp land of 2.5 _ 8 feet.The school closed so children could pick potatoes. They stopped potatoes because there weren't enough pickers. They had 44 men and 12 women. There are 4 men now. The workers were paid Â£12.00 monthly. They now have 10 tractors and 2 combines. They shop in Crowle, Goole and the village. There were 4 shops in Eastoft + a post office now 1 post office. In the 1960's they sold horses for tractors. Formerly 75% of the crop went on the Goole light railway which closed in 1964. Now goes by road. Most people are Roman Catholic (50%) Chapel (25%) Church of England (25%).
